triageFlags.description: Credit report is not provided for this proposal.
triageFlags.recommendation: Request the credit report or deny the application.
triageFlags.reasoning: The credit report is missing, which is a critical document required for the underwriting process to assess the applicant's financial history. Without it, an accurate analysis of creditworthiness cannot be conducted.

triageFlags.title: Low Credit Score in Credit Tier C
triageFlags.description: The applicant's credit score falls within the 'Sub-Prime' (Tier C) category, which is below the expected threshold for a lower risk tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Proceed with caution and apply all relevant Tier C restrictions (e.g., higher deposit requirement).
triageFlags.reasoning: As per policy, Section 2.1, a credit score of 550-619 is classified as Tier C (Sub-Prime). Lending is allowed in this tier with stricter scrutiny and additional requirements.

triageFlags.title: Above-Minimum Cash Deposit for Tier C
triageFlags.description: Cash deposit exceeds Tier C minimum requirement of 10% of the vehicle's cost.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider this as a compensating factor when assessing the overall risk of the deal.
triageFlags.reasoning: As per policy note 4.4, a minimum cash deposit of 10% is required for Tier C applicants. The provided deposit meets and exceeds this requirement, potentially mitigating some risk.

triageFlags.title: Loan-to-Value Ratio Within Tier C Limits
triageFlags.description: The calculated LTV ratio of 67.97% is well within the maximum allowable threshold of 95% for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: No action is necessary for LTV compliance.
triageFlags.reasoning: Section 4.1 of the policy states that the maximum LTV for Tier C applicants is 95%. The calculated LTV of 67.97% is compliant and significantly lower than this limit, reducing risk.

triageFlags.title: Below Minimum Credit Score for Tier C
triageFlags.expectedValue: 620+ for Tier B or 550+ for Tier C
triageFlags.description: The applicant's credit score is below the minimum required for Tier C.
triageFlags.recommendation: Either deny the application or propose a higher deposit to mitigate risk.
triageFlags.reasoning: Per the credit policy, Tier C requires a credit score between 550 and 619. The applicant's score of 560 meets Tier C requirements; however, it falls below Tier B thresholds.

triageFlags.title: Cash Deposit Above Requirements
triageFlags.description: The applicant's cash deposit exceeds the minimum required for Tier C.
triageFlags.recommendation: No action needed; document as a mitigating factor for other risks.
triageFlags.reasoning: Policy requires a minimum 10% cash deposit for Tier C applicants. The applicant has provided 12.2%, which is favorable and suggests stronger credit quality.

triageFlags.title: Vehicle Age Within Acceptable Range
triageFlags.expectedValue: Max 8 years; Max 12 years at loan end
triageFlags.description: The vehicle's age is within the acceptable range per policy.
triageFlags.reasoning: According to policy Section 4.2, the vehicle's age is acceptable as it would be 9 years old at the end of the term, which is under the 12-year cap given the 36-month term.

triageFlags.title: Excessive DTI - Policy Violation
triageFlags.description: Applicant's Debt-to-Income ratio greatly exceeds the maximum allowable limit.
triageFlags.recommendation: Decline the application as it is not financially viable for the applicant.
triageFlags.reasoning: Policy 3.1 dictates a maximum allowable DTI of 35% for Tier C applicants. The calculated DTI for the applicant is 435%, which is significantly above the threshold and indicates that the proposed monthly instalments are unaffordable based on the applicant's stated income.

triageFlags.title: Excessive Debt-to-Income Ratio
triageFlags.description: The Debt-to-Income ratio far exceeds the maximum allowable threshold.
triageFlags.recommendation: Deny the application, as the applicant cannot afford the proposed financing terms.
triageFlags.reasoning: Policy Section 3.1 limits the maximum DTI ratio to 35% for Tier C applicants. The applicant's DTI is calculated at 435%, highlighting a severe affordability issue.
